(UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20:52, 2 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Mason Tony Mount''' (born 10 January 1999) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] of the [[EFL Championship|Championship]], on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] from {{English football updater|Chelsea}} club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Mount was born in [[Portsmouth]], Hampshire.{{cite news |url=https://www.portsmouth.co.uk/sport/football/portsmouth-born-talent-signs-for-chelsea-1-7161622 |title=Portsmouth-born talent signs for Chelsea |first=Jeff |last=Marshman |newspaper=The News |location=Portsmouth |date=15 January 2016 |accessdate=10 October 2018}} He was playing under-6 football in local leagues as a four-year-old and spent one day a week training in the academies of [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] and [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].{{cite news |url=https://www.vi.nl/pro/overig/mason-mount-vitesse-pareltje-dat-uitzondering-op-chelsea-regel-moet-worden |title=Mason Mount, Vitesse-pareltje dat uitzondering op Chelsea-regel moet worden |trans-title=Mason Mount, Vitesse gem that should be the exception to Chelsea rule |first=Stef |last=De Bont |website=Voetbal International |date=14 December 2017 |accessdate=10 October 2018 |language=Dutch}} Mount joined Chelsea at the age of six, in 2005.{{citation needed|date=October 2018}} He made his [[Chelsea F.C. Under-23s and Academy|under-18]] debut as an under-15 during the [[2013–14 Chelsea F.C. season|2013–14 season]] and added several more appearances in the [[2014–15 Chelsea F.C. season|following season]].{{citation needed|date=October 2018}} Mount went on to play for both under-18 and under-21 teams during the [[2016–17 Chelsea F.C. season|2016–17 season]], in which he scored 10 goals in 30 appearances.{{citation needed|date=October 2018}} He signed a new four-year contract with Chelsea in July 2017.{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/mount-signs-new-deal-and-heads-to-vitesse.html |title=Mount signs new deal and heads to Vitesse |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=24 July 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171007232919/http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/mount-signs-new-deal-and-heads-to-vitesse.html |archivedate=7 October 2017}} ===Loan to Vitesse=== Mount joined Dutch [[Eredivisie]] club [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]] on 24 July 2017 on a season-long [[Loan (sports)|loan]]. He made his first-team debut on 26 August, as a 77th-minute [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] during Vitesse's 2–1 home defeat against [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]].{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2017/08/26/netherlands/eredivisie/sbv-vitesse/stichting-az/2462357/ |title=Vitesse vs. AZ 1–2 |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=10 October 2018}} The following month, he was given his first start in Vitesse's [[KNVB Cup]] first-round defeat away to fifth-tier team [[AVV Swift|Swift]], playing the full 90 minutes of the 0–0 draw, which Swift won in a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]].{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2017/09/20/netherlands/knvb-beker/swift/sbv-vitesse/2580810/ |title=Swift vs. Vitesse 0–0 |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=10 October 2018}} He scored his first goal for Vitesse on 1 October in the 76th minute of a 1–1 home draw with [[FC Utrecht|Utrecht]].{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2017/10/01/netherlands/eredivisie/sbv-vitesse/stichting-fc-utrecht/2462399/ |title=Vitesse vs. Utrecht 1–1 |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=10 October 2018}} Mount went onto appear in the Eredivisie Team of the Week on several occasions and win the Vitesse Player of the Year award.{{cite web |url=https://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/2018/4/29/17299438/mason-mount-becomes-third-chelsea-loanee-to-win-vitesse-player-of-the-year-award |title=Mason Mount becomes third Chelsea loanee to win Vitesse Player of the Year award |first=Ram |last=Srinivas |website=We Ain't Got No History |publisher=Vox Media |date=29 April 2018 |accessdate=10 October 2018}} During Vitesse's Eredivisie European play-off semi-final first leg against [[ADO Den Haag]] on 9 May 2018, Mount scored his first hat-trick, as Vitesse won 5–2 away. In the second leg, Mount scored in a 2–1 win as Vitesse won 7–3 on aggregate. In the first leg of the final against Utrecht, Mount opened the scoring but was booked and therefore suspended for the second leg. Mount made 39 appearances in all competitions for Vitesse, scoring 14 times, before returning to Chelsea. ===Loan to Derby County=== Mount joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] on 17 July 2018 on a season-long loan.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44860172 |title=Derby County sign youngsters Mason Mount and Harry Wilson on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 July 2018 |accessdate=17 July 2018}} He scored a 60th-minute equaliser on his debut for Derby on 3 August 2018, during a 2–1 away victory over [[Reading F.C.|Reading]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44976502 |title=Reading 1–2 Derby County |first=Adam |last=Williams |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 August 2018 |accessdate=10 October 2018}} ==International career== Mount has represented England at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]] and [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] levels.{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/all-teams/players?p=356955 |title=Mason Mount |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=12 August 2017}}{{dead link|date=October 2018}} Mount represented the under-17s at the [[2016 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]].{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2016/may/04/euro-finals-squad-announced-040516 |title=England under-17s squad named for Euro Championship |first=Nicholas |last=Veevers |publisher=The Football Association |date=4 May 2016 |accessdate=10 October 2018}} Mount was included in the under-19 team for the [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]].{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/jun/26/england-u19-squad-for-euros-260617 |title=Squad for U19 Euro |publisher=The Football Association |date=26 June 2017 |accessdate=10 October 2018}} He provided the assist for [[Lukas Nmecha]] to score the winning goal against [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal]] in the final.{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/jul/15/report-2017-uefa-u19-championship-final-portugal-england-150717 |title=Portugal 1–2 England U19s |first=Andy |last=Walker |publisher=The Football Association |date=15 July 2017 |accessdate=10 October 2018}} He was subsequently named [[UEFA European Under-19 Championship#Golden Player Award|Golden Player]] of the tournament.{{cite web |url=https://www.uefa.com/under19/history/season=2017/goldenplayer/index.html |title=2017: Mason Mount |publisher=UEFA |date=25 July 2017 |accessdate=10 October 2018}} Following his impressive season with Vitesse, Mount was invited by manager [[Gareth Southgate]] to train with the [[England national football team|senior team]] for a week ahead of the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite news |url=https://www.portsmouth.co.uk/sport/football/pompey/portsmouth-born-mount-to-train-with-southgate-s-england-squad-1-8503986 |title=Portsmouth-born Mount to train with Southgate's England squad |first=Will |last=Rooney |newspaper=The News |location=Portsmouth |date=18 May 2018 |accessdate=10 October 2018}} He was called up to the senior team for the [[UEFA Nations League]] matches against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] and [[Spain national football team|Spain]] in October 2018.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45744731 |title=James Maddison, Jadon Sancho and Mason Mount named in England squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 October 2018 |accessdate=10 October 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 1 January 2019}} {| class=wikitable
